com.here.mobility.sdk.map

Class RotationSensorDirectionSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.mobility.sdk.map.RotationSensorDirectionSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DeviceDirectionSource

    public class RotationSensorDirectionSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements DeviceDirectionSource
    An implementation of DeviceDirectionSource via Android's Sensor.TYPE_ROTATION_VECTOR sensor.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.here.mobility.sdk.map.DeviceDirectionSource

        DeviceDirectionSource.DirectionListener

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RotationSensorDirectionSource(android.content.Context context, int samplingPeriodUs)
      Creates a new RotationSensorDirectionSource with the given context and sample rate in microseconds (see SensorManager.registerListener(SensorEventListener, Sensor, int) for details).

      Returns whether the device direction is available.

    • Method Detail

      • setTargetDisplay

        public void setTargetDisplay(@Nullable
                             android.view.Display targetDisplay)
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDirectionSource
        Sets the display relative to whose orientation the angle is returned. For example, a device in landscape orientation "points" to a different direction than one in portrait mode. A null value indicates the device's "natural" orientation.
        Specified by:
        setTargetDisplay in interface DeviceDirectionSource

      • isDirectionAvailable

        public boolean isDirectionAvailable()
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDirectionSource
        Returns whether the device direction is available. This may be false, if, for example, the device lacks the hardware sensors needed to determine direction.
        Specified by:
        isDirectionAvailable in interface DeviceDirectionSource

      • setDirectionListener

        public void setDirectionListener(@Nullable
                                 DeviceDirectionSource.DirectionListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDirectionSource
        Sets the listener to receive notifications when the device's direction changes. Call with the null value to remove a previously set listener.
        Specified by:
        setDirectionListener in interface DeviceDirectionSource
